Home.title: Bridging the Gap Between Aerial Intelligence and Farmer Action
Home.description: Turn Drone Imagery into Local-Language Crop Insights for Every Farmer. From aerial data to actionable words—delivered in their language.

steps.title: Upload Drone Image
steps.text: The farmer captures aerial images using a drone and uploads them through the Drone Crop app. The system supports JPEG/PNG formats with location tagging.

steps.title: Image Preprocessing
steps.text: Uploaded images are resized, denoised, and normalized to ensure they are clean and consistent for analysis. Quality checks are also performed.

steps.title: ML Model Analysis
steps.text: A trained deep learning model analyzes the image to detect signs of diseases (e.g., rust, mosaic) and assess crop vitality based on visual patterns.

steps.title: LLM Interpretation
steps.text: A language model interprets ML results to generate detailed crop health reports and personalized suggestions for intervention or treatment.

steps.title: Multilingual Conversion
steps.text: Reports are translated into the farmer’s preferred language (e.g., Hindi, Tamil, Telugu) for better accessibility and local relevance.

steps.title: Audio Output (TTS)
steps.text: Textual insights are converted into audio using text-to-speech. This benefits low-literacy users and supports inclusive advisory delivery.

steps.title: Notification Delivery
steps.text: Final results are delivered to the farmer via email, SMS, or push notification. They receive a link to view or listen to the complete report.

about.title: About Drone Crop
about.mission_description: Drone Crop aims to make advanced agricultural insights accessible to every farmer, regardless of their background or digital literacy. By transforming complex drone and satellite data into clear, actionable advice in local languages, we empower farmers to make informed decisions for healthier crops and better yields.
about.why_description: Many farmers face challenges understanding technical crop health data. Our platform bridges this gap by providing personalized, easy-to-understand crop health reports, supporting timely actions like nutrient management and pest control. We believe that technology should serve everyone, and our solutions are designed to be inclusive and practical for real-world farming needs.
about.offer_1: AI-powered summaries of drone and satellite imagery, highlighting key crop health issues.
about.offer_2: Support for multiple Indian languages, ensuring accessibility for farmers across regions.
about.offer_3: Seamless integration with agri-drone platforms and mobile advisory services.
about.offer_4: Curated datasets from Indian farms to improve and validate our crop analysis models.

services.title: Our Services
services.ai_description: Our generative AI model transforms drone and satellite imagery into natural-language crop health reports, highlighting issues like disease spread, nutrient deficiency, water stress, and weed coverage.
services.language_description: We generate crop health insights in Hindi, Kannada, Tamil, Bengali, and other Indian languages, making our services accessible to farmers across diverse regions.
services.integration_description: Our integration modules connect with agri-drone platforms and mobile advisory systems, including Kisan Call Centers and agri-tech apps, for smooth delivery of actionable advice.
services.data_description: We maintain a labeled dataset of annotated drone images from Indian farms, supporting the training and validation of region-specific crop health analysis models.

features: Converts translated insights to natural speech
Provides downloadable audio or in-app playback
Helps visually impaired or low-literacy farmers

info_iphone.title: How do I enable Geotagging on my iPhone

steps.text: 1. Open Settings - Go to your iPhone's home screen and tap on Settings.
2. Scroll down and tap on Privacy & Security (On iOS 16 and above, it's called Privacy & Security.)
3. Tap on Location Services
4. Make sure Location Services is ON - If it's off, toggle it on.
5. Scroll down to find Camera (Or search for "Camera" in the Settings search bar.)
6. Tap on Camera
7. Set Allow Location Access to "While Using the App" or "Ask Next Time" - This allows the Camera app to embed location data into photos.

info_android.title: How do i enable Geotagging on my Android phone

steps.text: 1. Open the Camera app
2. Go to Camera Settings - Usually, there's a gear ⚙️ icon somewhere in the Camera app — top corner or menu.
3. Look for Location Tags / Save Location / Geo-tagging - The option may be called: Location Tags (Samsung), Save Location (Pixel), or Geo-tagging (others)
4. Turn it ON
